author: SeeminglyScience
body:
### Steps to reproduce

```powershell
$lg = $PSStyle.Foreground.LightGreen
$lb = $PSStyle.Foreground.LightBlue
$lr = $PSStyle.Foreground.LightRed
$lc = $PSStyle.Foreground.LightCyan

$object = [PSCustomObject]@{
    Value = "${lg}a${lb}b${lr}c${lc}d${lg}e${lb}f${lr}g${lc}h"
}

$object | ft @{ e='Value'; Width = 7 }
```

### Expected behavior

```console
Value
-----
abcdefg
```


### Actual behavior

```console
Value
-----
a…
```

### Environment data

```powershell
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.2.0-preview.8
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.2.0-preview.8
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18363
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```


### Visuals

For a real world example, I was working on enhancing `ClassExplorer\Find-Member`'s formatting with a better "metadata view":

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24977523/130332623-17c16b71-211c-4a64-bf00-a3ec6970a7c1.png)

Most of the signature is cut off in the last member, and the ellipses appears to have been placed in one of the escape sequences.
